0.text: Bug 30570  DBCS - GB18030: Input GB18030 characters as run arguments cause eclipse for motif crash..

1.text: Bug: Input GB18030 character as run arguments cause eclipse for motif crash.

2.text: Language: Simplified Chinese  Testcase: RD2          Build driver: 200212181304 Stable Build (M4) for Motif  OS: RedHat 8.0  JRE Version: J2RE 1.3.1 IBM build cxia32131-20021102 (JIT enabled: jitc) 	    J2RE 1.4.0 IBM build cxia32140-20020917a (JIT enabled:jitc)) 		             Summary: When I begin to run a java class, and input GB18030 characters as  project arguments, eclipse crashed.

3.text: Steps to recreate problem: 	1.creat a new project and build it correctly.

4.text: 2.Click menu Run->Run..., then the "Run window" show up.

5.text: 3.select "Arguments" tab, input some GB18030 characters  as the  Program arguments.

7.text: <<Error>> 	In step 3, I can wake up IME, but after I input a GB18030 character,  the eclipse crashed.

8.text: (As is shown in RunCrash.jpg)  <<Expected Result>> 	Could run project correctly.

9.text: Comments 	I can use GB2312 as program arguments correctly.

10.text: In Eclipse with GTK build, this function is ok.
